SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
SEO: Provide More Storefront Data to External Search Engines

Attract more traffic by delivering higher-quality information to search engine bots that crawl your storefront pages. Boost your SEO ranking by eliminating potentially duplicated index results, improving link equity within your pages, and showing more content directly in Google results.

Serve a Bot-Enabled Product List Page and Product Detail Page
To make it easier for search engine bots to index your categories, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves a bot-enabled Product List page for category results. Also, to improve the amount of product content that bots can index, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves more information on the bot-enabled Product Detail page. These changes also improve link equity across your storefront pages, which boosts the SEO ranking of your products and categories in external search results.
Serve More Product Structured Data to Google Search Results
To improve the credibility of your products in Google search results, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now provides more structured data about your products. This change adds breadcrumbs, product images, and SKU information to the structured data shown in a Google search result. And, best of all, no additional setup is required to start taking advantage of this change.
Include Canonical Links on More Pages
To prevent search engine bots from following multiple paths to the same page and indexing duplicate results, canonical links are now available in more pages. B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically inserts a canonical link in the <head> of the Home, Product List, and Product Detail pages. B2B Commerce for Visualforce includes all canonical links in the sitemap, which helps a search engine bot find and crawl all of your pages more easily. And, if you’ve set up friendly URLs for products and categories, the canonical link uses your friendly URL values, too.
Let Search Engine Bots Discover and Crawl More Links
Links to the Home, Product List, and Product Detail pages now use href attribute values that B2B Commerce for Visualforce generates when the page loads. Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce navigated one of these links during the JavaScript onClick event, but search engine bots can’t crawl these types of links. B2B Commerce still checks for updated page parameters in the onClick event. This change allows search engine bots to crawl and index more of your storefront.
Include More Search Metadata in the Product Detail Page
The SEO Title and SEO Description fields of a CC Product record now support up to 255 characters—up from 200. With this change, you can include more product content in the Product Detail page’s metadata. This content surfaces directly in search engine results.

title: B2B Commerce for Visualforce SEO and Upgrade Guide
